snippet: Classifications ensure that Paralympic athletes compete against others with similar levels of ability, but the distinctions are not always obvious.
abstract: Entrants in the London Paralympics undergo a rigorous classification process to ensure that they compete against others with similar levels of ability, but the distinctions are not always obvious; many Paralympians have several disabilities, and the classification process varies from sport to sport.
lead_paragraph: Classifications ensure that Paralympic athletes compete against others with similar levels of ability, but the distinctions are not always obvious.

headline.seo: At Paralympics, First Thing Judged Is Disability
headline.main: At Paralympics, First Thing Judged Is Disability
headline.print_headline: At Paralympics, First Thing Judged Is Disability
